pros: Good wage nice company to work

review_title: Constant work without recognition, interesting subject matter. No loyalty or regard for employees.
pros:
You will feel like you are contributing to positive change in the investment and indexation industries. Big plus.
The projects are interesting and cutting edge in terms of research.
The salarys are reasonable as they want people from industry to work in the institute.
The London building is nice, like an Atrium.
You may get to travel to present at conferences.
cons:
The high bonuses promised are for show. No-one ever got any bonus as the firm isn't a revenue generator.
Management have used staff for specific projects before getting rid of them directly or making life unbearable.
There are a multitude of projects given to each senior employee and there is no respect for a maximum workload. I worked at least half a day on most weekends.
Recognition is just not being lambasted. This is inherent.
I am unsure what the scope for progression is within the firm.
Short employee tenure. Ex employees unhappy as are many who still work there.

pros:
Good balance between busy and more relaxed times. Good colleagues to work with in the London office and in the French one. Getting to communicate in both English and French.
Long annual leave entitlement.
cons:
Sometimes lack of communication between departments/people within the same department. I only get to speak French and English, no German or Spanish unfortunately.
In the London office sick days are taken off your annual leave and office always closes the first two weeks of August, so those are compulsory holidays for everyone.

pros: Good money, great start and finish times plus great employees
cons: Dusty on the site most of the time
